intro: Swartzia bannia, commonly known as the Bannia wood or Bannia ironwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae), characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The tree is notable for its dense, heavy wood that is highly valued for its strength and durability. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 20 meters. Swartzia bannia is also known for its ornamental value, with attractive leaves and small, fragrant flowers.
